title: Easeout Weekly #18
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![Developer Gradient](/images/uploads/dx.jpg) [What is Developer Experience (DX)?](https://css-tricks.com/what-is-developer-experience-dx/) Developer Experience[](https://css-tricks.com/what-is-developer-experience-dx/#fn:1) is a term[](https://css-tricks.com/what-is-developer-experience-dx/#fn:1) with a self-declaring meaning —*the experience of developers*— but it eludes definition in the sense that people invoke it at different times for different reasons referring to different things. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/what-is-developer-experience-dx/)
![Solitaire](/images/uploads/solitaire.png) [Easing Animations in Canvas](https://css-tricks.com/easing-animations-in-canvas/) This article looks specifically at animation in canvas and techniques to make them look smoother. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/easing-animations-in-canvas/)
![Guardian Home Page](/images/uploads/the-guardian-homepage.png) [What Vitruvius Can Teach Us About Web Design](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/vitruvius-web-design/) The ancients can teach us a thing or two about design — even web design. The Roman architect Vitruvius had buildings in mind when laying out his golden triad, but its principles are just as applicable to the web as they are to brick and mortar. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/vitruvius-web-design/)
![Mop and Bucket](/images/uploads/mop-bucket.png) [Stay DRY Using axios for API Requests](https://css-tricks.com/stay-dry-using-axios-for-api-requests/) This article takes a look at how we can write DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) HTTP requests using Axios. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/stay-dry-using-axios-for-api-requests/)
![Flutter logo](/images/uploads/flutter-sharing-image-large.png) [Solving Common Cross-Platform Issues When Working With Flutter](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/common-cross-platform-issues-flutter/) When using cross-platform frameworks, people might forget the nuances of each of the platforms they want their code to run on. This article aims to address that. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/common-cross-platform-issues-flutter/)
![Jigglypuff CSS](/images/uploads/jigglypuff.png) [Advice for Complex CSS Illustrations](https://css-tricks.com/advice-for-complex-css-illustrations/) While there is no “one size fits all” approach to CSS illustration, Jhey Tompkins shows us his set of techniques that might help you on your journey. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/advice-for-complex-css-illustrations/)
![Browser Tiled Logos](/images/uploads/browsers-tiled.png) [Web Engine Diversity and Ecosystem Health](https://bkardell.com/blog/EcosystemHealth.html) For many years, we've seen lots of conversation on the topic of "browser engine diversity". Brian Kardell offers a slightly tilted view of this based instead on "the health of the ecosystem", and he explains why this is more valuable measure to discuss these topics. [Read it ➡️](https://bkardell.com/blog/EcosystemHealth.html)
![Immer Article Card](/images/uploads/better-reducers-with-immer.png) [Better Reducers With Immer](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/better-reducers-with-immer/) In this article, we’re going to learn how to use Immer to write reducers. Manually writing reducers results in bloated code where we have to touch almost every part of our state. We’re going to see how Immer brings more simplicity to the process of writing state reducers. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/better-reducers-with-immer/)
![React Flip Animations](/images/uploads/flip-react.png) [Everything You Need to Know About FLIP Animations in React](https://css-tricks.com/everything-you-need-to-know-about-flip-animations-in-react/) One of the most efficient approaches to animation is[](https://css-tricks.com/animating-layouts-with-the-flip-technique/) FLIP. Let’s take a look at the intersection of using the WAAPI, FLIP, and integrating all that into React. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/everything-you-need-to-know-about-flip-animations-in-react/)
![Video Call Demo](/images/uploads/video-conferencing-tools-microsoft-teams-meeting-desktop.png) [Which Video Conferencing Tools Are Most Accessible?](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/accessible-video-conferencing-tools/) In this article, Claudio Luis Vera explains what to keep in mind when choosing between video conferencing tools to benefit everyone on your team — including those with disabilities. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/06/accessible-video-conferencing-tools/)
![Shoptalk Show Logo](/images/uploads/shoptalk.png) [RSS Feeds, MMO Games, DnD, and Custom Fields](https://shoptalkshow.com/417/) This week on Shoptalk: we're talking RSS feeds, Gemstone 4, MMO games, DnD, Jekyll vs Eleventy performance, email newsletters, Github and Microsoft, and strategies for dealing with Jamstack page jank. [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/416/)
![WordPress Block Editor](/images/uploads/wp-block-editor.jpeg) [Adding a Custom Welcome Guide to the WordPress Block Editor](https://css-tricks.com/adding-a-custom-welcome-guide-to-the-wordpress-block-editor/) This article shows us how to bake documentation directly into a Wordpress plugin and make it easily accessible in the block editor. This way, users get to use the plugin right away while having answers to common questions directly where they’re working. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/adding-a-custom-welcome-guide-to-the-wordpress-block-editor/)
## Previous Issue: * [Easeout Weekly #17](https://www.easeout.co/blog/2020-06-15-easeout-weekly-17)
short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
